greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The powerfree part of the central binomial coefficients.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3388
example: n=14, binomial(14,7) = 3432 = 8*3*11*13. The largest square divisor is 4, and the squarefree part is 858. So GCD(4,858) = 2 and a(14) = 858/2 = 429.
mathematica: a[n_] := Denominator[(b = Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]])/(Times @@ First /@ FactorInteger[b])^2]; Array[a, 36] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 05 2020 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 26 2000
ext: New name and more terms from _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 05 2020
